content: SECTION 1. FINDINGS AND PURPOSES. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, highlighting their benefits such as harboring diverse species, supporting pharmaceutical development, and boosting marine tourism and food sources. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance in providing food, jobs, storm protection, and ecosystem services. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance in providing food, jobs, storm protection, and ecosystem services. The amendment also addresses unsustainable exploitation of coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance in providing food, jobs, storm protection, and ecosystem services. The amendment also addresses unsustainable exploitation of these ecosystems. Section 803 of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance and addressing unsustainable exploitation. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, expanding conservation efforts to address unsustainable exploitation. The terms Conservation Agreement, Conservation Facility, and Conservation Fund are defined in the legislation. The term 'Conservation Fund' refers to a fund established in section 810. 'Coral' includes various species of the phylum Cnidaria. 'Coral reef' is defined as a reef primarily made up of corals. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1988 is amended to establish a Conservation Facility and expand eligibility for benefits to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Debt owed to the United States as a result of concessional loans can be reduced under this Act. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1988 is amended to establish a Conservation Fund and expand eligibility for benefits to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Amendments include changes to terms and conditions, authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2007 through 2010, and allocation of funds for audits, evaluations, monitoring, and administration. SEC. 6 amends the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 by changing the name of the fund. SEC. 7 addresses U.S. government representation on oversight bodies for grants related to debt-for-nature swaps and debt-buybacks. Section 808(a)(5) of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to allow individuals appointed by the United States Government to serve on the administering body overseeing grants from debt-for-nature swaps or debt buy-backs, regardless of the U.S.'s involvement in agreements with beneficiary countries. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to change the authority of the Secretary of State, update the Conservation Agreement, and modify eligible activities. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, expand eligible activities to include water, and update grant recipient qualifications to cover marine resources. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, expand eligible activities to include water, and update grant recipient qualifications to cover marine resources. Grants over $250,000 require approval from the US and beneficiary country governments. The section heading is changed from "tropical forest" to "conservation." SEC. 9. CONSERVATION FUND. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to establish a Conservation Fund, replacing the Tropical Forest Fund. Technical and conforming amendments are made to update terms and conditions. SEC. 10. BOARD. Section 811 of the Act is repealed. SEC. 11. ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE CONGRESS. SEC. 11 of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to change the reporting deadline from December 31 to April 15 and replace "fiscal year" with "calendar year". Subsection (b) is also removed. The heading of part V of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is renamed the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2007. References to the previous act are now deemed to refer to the new act. Amounts from the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 can now be used for the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2007. Sections in the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 are redesignated. Amendments are made to certain sections of the Act. The text chunk discusses the criteria for arrangements under the structural adjustment facility or enhanced structural adjustment facility, Fund monitored programs, or sound macroeconomic policies. The House of Representatives passed the document on October 9, 2007, as attested by LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
